snippet: Rowan County, where Kim Davis was jailed for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, has seen the politesse and grace that has marked the community unravel.
abstract: Controversy over Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis' refusal to issue marriage licenses to gay couples is straining relations in ideologically divided city of Morehead, Ky; presence of Morehead State University has brought progressive strain to municipality in conservative state.
lead_paragraph: Rowan County, where Kim Davis was jailed for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, has seen the politesse and grace that has marked the community unravel.

headline.main: Kentucky Clerk’s Stance Tests County Where Opposing Views Are Welcomed
headline.print_headline: A City Used to Tolerating Opposing Views Is Tested by a County Clerk’s Stance

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
